nt":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_newForgeValidator","type":"address"}],"name":"upgradeForgeValidator","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"author":"Stability Ltd.","details":"VERSION: 2.0         DATE:    2020-11-14","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"collectInterest()":{"details":"Converts recently accrued swap fees into mIx","return":"swapFeesGained        Equivalent amount of mIx units that have been generatednewSupply             New total mIx supply"},"collectPlatformInterest()":{"details":"Collects the interest generated from the Basket, minting a relative     amount of mIx and sending it over to the SavingsManager.","return":"interestGained   Lending market interest collectednewSupply             New total mIx supply"},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"getBasketManager()":{"details":"Gets the address of the BasketManager for this mIx","return":"basketManager Address"},"getSwapOutput(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Determines both if a trade is valid, and the expected fee or output. Swap is valid if it does not result in the input asset exceeding its maximum weight.","params":{"_input":"bAsset to deposit","_output":"Asset to receive - bAsset or mIx(this)","_quantity":"Units of input bAsset to swap"},"return":"valid        Bool to signify that swap is current validreason       If swap is invalid, this is the reasonoutput       Units of _output asset the trade would return"},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"initialize(string,string,address,address,address)":{"details":"Constructor"},"lockForgeValidator()":{"details":"Locks the ForgeValidator into it's final form. Called by Governor"},"mint(address,uint256)":{"details":"Mint a single bAsset, at a 1:1 ratio with the bAsset. This contract     must have approval to spend the senders bAsset","params":{"_bAsset":"Address of the bAsset to mint","_bAssetQuantity":"Quantity in bAsset units"},"return":"mixMinted   Number of newly minted mIxs"},"mintMulti(address[],uint256[],address)":{"details":"Mint with multiple bAssets, at a 1:1 ratio to mIx. This contract     must have approval to spend the senders bAssets","params":{"_bAssetQuantity":"Quantity of each bAsset to mint. Order of array                         should mirror the above","_bAssets":"Non-duplicate address array of bAssets with which to mint","_recipient":"Address to receive the newly minted mIx tokens"},"return":"mixMinted     Number of newly minted mIxs"},"mintTo(address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Mint a single bAsset, at a 1:1 ratio with the bAsset. This contract     must have approval to spend the senders bAsset","params":{"_bAsset":"Address of the bAsset to mint","_bAssetQuantity":"Quantity in bAsset units","_recipient":"receipient of the newly minted mIx tokens"},"return":"mixMinted   Number of newly minted mIxs"},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"redeem(address,uint256)":{"details":"Credits the sender with a certain quantity of selected bAsset, in exchange for burning the     relative mIx quantity from the sender. Sender also incurs a small mIx fee, if any.","params":{"_bAsset":"Address of the bAsset to redeem","_bAssetQuantity":"Units of the bAsset to redeem"},"return":"mixMinted     Relative number of mIx units burned to pay for the bAssets"},"redeemMix(uint256,address)":{"details":"Credits a recipient with a proportionate amount of bAssets, relative to current vault balance levels and desired mIx quantity. Burns the mIx as payment.","params":{"_mIxQuantity":"Quantity of mIx to redeem","_recipient":"Address to credit the withdrawn bAssets"}},"redeemMulti(address[],uint256[],address)":{"details":"Credits a recipient with a certain quantity of selected bAssets, in exchange for burning the     relative Mix quantity from the sender. Sender also incurs a small fee on the outgoing asset.","params":{"_bAssetQuantities":"Units of the bAssets to redeem","_bAssets":"Address of the bAssets to redeem","_recipient":"Address to credit with withdrawn bAssets"},"return":"mixMinted     Relative number of mIx units burned to pay for the bAssets"},"redeemTo(address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Credits a recipient with a certain quantity of selected bAsset, in exchange for burning the     relative Mix quantity from the sender. Sender also incurs a small fee, if any.","params":{"_bAsset":"Address of the bAsset to redeem","_bAssetQuantity":"Units of the bAsset to redeem","_recipient":"Address to credit with withdrawn bAssets"},"return":"mixMinted     Relative number of mIx units burned to pay for the bAssets"},"setCacheSize(uint256)":{"details":"Sets the MAX cache size for each bAsset. The cache will actually revolve around     _cacheSize * totalSupply / 2 under normal circumstances.","params":{"_cacheSize":"Maximum percent of total mIx supply to hold for each bAsset"}},"setRedemptionFee(uint256)":{"details":"Set the ecosystem fee for redeeming a mIx","params":{"_redemptionFee":"Fee calculated in (%/100 * 1e18)"}},"setSwapFee(uint256)":{"details":"Set the ecosystem fee for redeeming a mIx","params":{"_swapFee":"Fee calculated in (%/100 * 1e18)"}},"swap(address,address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Simply swaps one bAsset for another bAsset or this mIx at a 1:1 ratio. bAsset <> bAsset swaps will incur a small fee (swapFee()). Swap is valid if it does not result in the input asset exceeding its maximum weight.","params":{"_input":"bAsset to deposit","_output":"Asset to receive - either a bAsset or mIx(this)","_quantity":"Units of input bAsset to swap","_recipient":"Address to credit output asset"},"return":"output       Units of output asset returned"},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"upgradeForgeValidator(address)":{"details":"Upgrades the version of ForgeValidator protocol. Governor can do this     only while ForgeValidator is unlocked.","params":{"_newForgeValidator":"Address of the new ForgeValidator"}}},"title":"Mix"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"initialize(string,string,address,address,address)":{"notice":"To avoid variable shadowing appended `Arg` after arguments name."}},"notice":"The Mix is a token that allows minting and redemption at a 1:1 ratio         for underlying basket assets (bAssets) of the same peg (i.e. USD,         EUR, Gold). Composition and validation is enforced via the nodes.name: getBasketManager
collectInterest
collectPlatformInterest

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

collectInterest().details: Converts recently accrued swap fees into mIx
collectInterest().return: swapFeesGained        Equivalent amount of mIx units that have been generatednewSupply             New total mIx supply

collectPlatformInterest().details: Collects the interest generated from the Basket, minting a relative     amount of mIx and sending it over to the SavingsManager.
collectPlatformInterest().return: interestGained   Lending market interest collectednewSupply             New total mIx supply

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getBasketManager().details: Gets the address of the BasketManager for this mIx

getSwapOutput(address,address,uint256).details: Determines both if a trade is valid, and the expected fee or output. Swap is valid if it does not result in the input asset exceeding its maximum weight.

params._output: Asset to receive - bAsset or mIx(this)
params._quantity: Units of input bAsset to swap

getSwapOutput(address,address,uint256).return: valid        Bool to signify that swap is current validreason       If swap is invalid, this is the reasonoutput       Units of _output asset the trade would return

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

lockForgeValidator().details: Locks the ForgeValidator into it's final form. Called by Governor

mint(address,uint256).details: Mint a single bAsset, at a 1:1 ratio with the bAsset. This contract     must have approval to spend the senders bAsset

params._bAsset: Address of the bAsset to mint

mint(address,uint256).return: mixMinted   Number of newly minted mIxs

mintMulti(address[],uint256[],address).details: Mint with multiple bAssets, at a 1:1 ratio to mIx. This contract     must have approval to spend the senders bAssets

params._bAssetQuantity: Quantity of each bAsset to mint. Order of array                         should mirror the above
params._bAssets: Non-duplicate address array of bAssets with which to mint
params._recipient: Address to receive the newly minted mIx tokens

mintMulti(address[],uint256[],address).return: mixMinted     Number of newly minted mIxs

mintTo(address,uint256,address).details: Mint a single bAsset, at a 1:1 ratio with the bAsset. This contract     must have approval to spend the senders bAsset

params._bAsset: Address of the bAsset to mint
params._recipient: receipient of the newly minted mIx tokens

mintTo(address,uint256,address).return: mixMinted   Number of newly minted mIxs

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

redeem(address,uint256).details: Credits the sender with a certain quantity of selected bAsset, in exchange for burning the     relative mIx quantity from the sender. Sender also incurs a small mIx fee, if any.

params._bAsset: Address of the bAsset to redeem
params._bAssetQuantity: Units of the bAsset to redeem

redeem(address,uint256).return: mixMinted     Relative number of mIx units burned to pay for the bAssets

redeemMix(uint256,address).details: Credits a recipient with a proportionate amount of bAssets, relative to current vault balance levels and desired mIx quantity. Burns the mIx as payment.

params._recipient: Address to credit the withdrawn bAssets

redeemMulti(address[],uint256[],address).details: Credits a recipient with a certain quantity of selected bAssets, in exchange for burning the     relative Mix quantity from the sender. Sender also incurs a small fee on the outgoing asset.

params._bAssetQuantities: Units of the bAssets to redeem
params._bAssets: Address of the bAssets to redeem
params._recipient: Address to credit with withdrawn bAssets

redeemMulti(address[],uint256[],address).return: mixMinted     Relative number of mIx units burned to pay for the bAssets

redeemTo(address,uint256,address).details: Credits a recipient with a certain quantity of selected bAsset, in exchange for burning the     relative Mix quantity from the sender. Sender also incurs a small fee, if any.

params._bAsset: Address of the bAsset to redeem
params._bAssetQuantity: Units of the bAsset to redeem
params._recipient: Address to credit with withdrawn bAssets

redeemTo(address,uint256,address).return: mixMinted     Relative number of mIx units burned to pay for the bAssets

setCacheSize(uint256).details: Sets the MAX cache size for each bAsset. The cache will actually revolve around     _cacheSize * totalSupply / 2 under normal circumstances.

params._cacheSize: Maximum percent of total mIx supply to hold for each bAsset

setRedemptionFee(uint256).details: Set the ecosystem fee for redeeming a mIx

setSwapFee(uint256).details: Set the ecosystem fee for redeeming a mIx

swap(address,address,uint256,address).details: Simply swaps one bAsset for another bAsset or this mIx at a 1:1 ratio. bAsset <> bAsset swaps will incur a small fee (swapFee()). Swap is valid if it does not result in the input asset exceeding its maximum weight.

params._output: Asset to receive - either a bAsset or mIx(this)
params._quantity: Units of input bAsset to swap

swap(address,address,uint256,address).return: output       Units of output asset returned

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

upgradeForgeValidator(address).details: Upgrades the version of ForgeValidator protocol. Governor can do this     only while ForgeValidator is unlocked.

initialize(string,string,address,address.notice: To avoid variable shadowing appended `Arg` after arguments name.

userdoc.notice: The Mix is a token that allows minting and redemption at a 1:1 ratio         for underlying basket assets (bAssets) of the same peg (i.e. USD,         EUR, Gold). Composition and validation is enforced via the BasketManager.
